citation.article-title: Rhodanobacter panaciterrae sp. nov., a bacterium with ginsenoside-converting activity isolated from soil of a ginseng field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhodanobacter panaciterrae sp. nov.
Rhodanobacter panaciterrae (pa.na.ci.ter′ra.e. N.L. n. Panax, -acis scientific name of ginseng; L. n. terra soil; N.L. gen. n. panaciterrae of soil of a ginseng field).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, non-motile rods after growth on R2A agar for 3 days.
Colonies on R2A agar after 3 days are smooth, circular, convex, transparent and yellowish.
Grows at 10–37 °C, but not at 4 or 42 °C, at pH 4–10 (optimum pH 7.0) and with 0–1 % NaCl (optimum 0 % NaCl).

Using the API ID 32GN system, utilizes d-glucose, maltose, l-proline, N-acetylglucosamine and d-ribose, but not l-arabinose, d-mannitol, caprate, l-histidine, l-alanine, citrate, salicin, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, itaconate, 2-ketogluconate, lactate, propionate, l-serine, suberate, gluconate, malate, adipate or phenylacetate as sole carbon sources.
With the API 20NE system, utilizes maltose but not d-mannitol or citrate.

With API ZYM, produces alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and β-glucosidase (linked with ginsenoside-converting activity), but not α- or β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase, α-fucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, lipase (C14) or trypsin.
Q-8 is the predominant major ubiquinone and iso-C16 : 0, iso-C17 : 1ω9c and iso-C15 : 0 are the predominant cellular fatty acids.
The type strain is LnR5-47T ( = KACC 12826T = KCTC 22232T = LMG 24460T), isolated from soil of a ginseng field in Liaoning province, China.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.2 mol%.
